response.overview: Media artist. After winning the Grand Prize at the Contemporary Japanese Art Exhibition for "Time Layer II," he has produced many interactive works. His live performance in collaboration with Ryuichi Sakamoto won the Grand Prize at Ars Electronica. His wide-ranging activities include the TV program "Ugo Ugo Ruga," the Nintendo DS-activated art piece "Electro Plankton," the musical instrument device "TENORI-ON," and a video exhibition at the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka. He is also active as a picture book author, with best-sellers such as "The House of 100 Stories" (08) and "Yubisaki-chan's Great Adventure" (16).
response.title: 12 O’CLOCK
